etymologies: mid 19th century: from Jamaican creole, from Akan, of imitative origin

definitions: a nocturnal, insectivorous bird resembling a large nightjar. Found in tropical America, it mimics a dead branch when alarmed.

notes.text: Genus Nyctibius and family Nyctibiidae: five species, in particular the common potoo (N. griseus)

shortDefinitions: nocturnal insectivorous bird resembling large nightjar
